intro: Cristaria aspera, commonly known as the rough spike moss, is a member of the family Hypnaceae and is characterized by its dense, spike-like clusters of leafy shoots. It is a cryptogamic plant, meaning it reproduces through spores rather than seeds, and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its rough, textured leaves that are often arranged in spirals along the stems. Cristaria aspera typically grows in temperate regions and is well-adapted to humid, nutrient-rich soils. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of the understory vegetation in many forest ecosystems.
